vtta-dndbeyond.image-upload-directory.hi: Specificies the avatar upload location on the server.
vtta-dndbeyond.scene-upload-directory.hi: Specificies the scene upload location on the server.
vtta-dndbeyond.entity-import-policy.name: Compendium import policy (GM only)
vtta-dndbeyond.entity-import-policy.hint: Defines if imported items should be saved into the compendiums below, and under which circumstances.
vtta-dndbeyond.entity-import-policy.0: Save all entities, overwrite existing ones
vtta-dndbeyond.entity-import-policy.1: Save new entities only, do not overwrite existing ones
vtta-dndbeyond.entity-import-policy.2: Do not save the entities at all
vtta-dndbeyond.entity-cleanup-policy.hin: When saving imports to compendiums, you can decide if you want to clean up the entities from the current world or keep them
vtta-dndbeyond.entity-cleanup-policy.0: Keep all entities in the world
vtta-dndbeyond.entity-monster-feature-co: Target compendium for imported monster features
vtta-dndbeyond.log-level.name: Log Level
vtta-dndbeyond.log-level.hint: The level of console log statements that should be displayed in the console.
vtta-dndbeyond.scene-format.name: Scene image format
vtta-dndbeyond.scene-format.hint: Sets the scene image format. WEBP is recommended due to smaller file size and faster loading speeds.
